entries.description: Completed AWS Elastic Beanstalk staging deployment follow-up tasks - staging environment now deploying without errors and initializing baseline test database.

Investigated and diagnosed LabX orphaned listing issue with Susan. Identified root cause: when models are merged in T-Rex, the catalog number of the destroyed model persists as an orphaned LabX listing since listings are only managed via explicit API calls. Developed three-part solution: (1) Update T-Rex 'Merge Models' facility to send explicit revoke-listing calls to LabX and Salesforce for destroyed models, (2) Compare and clean up existing LabX listings against T-Rex by catalog number, (3) Compare and clean up existing Salesforce listings against T-Rex by catalog number. Reviewed Kevin's note confirming in-stock evaluation logic is correct. Reviewed implementation plans for three safety net comprehensive updates including increased frequency LabX job runs under rate limits, weekly T-Rex in-stock check, and monthly comprehensive plus daily incremental Salesforce model updates.

Completed post-upgrade cleanup for RDS MySQL database instance upgrade. Executed all cleanup tasks including: (1) Deleted Blue/Green deployment infrastructure to eliminate deployment charges, (2) Created post-upgrade verification snapshot for additional safety, (3) Deleted old database instance (altproductiondatabase-old1) resulting in immediate monthly cost savings of approximately $19/month, (4) Archived all upgrade documentation to docs/database_upgrades/2025-11-01/ directory. Verified current database status (MySQL 5.7.44-rds.20250818) is running normally with all safety measures in place including multiple backup snapshots. Sent email summary to team and posted cleanup completion notice to Slack #t-rex channel.

Debugged and resolved bug #349 in SoftTrak project: User settings form reversion issue. Utilized frontend-debug skill with 6-phase systematic debugging workflow. Conducted root cause analysis revealing React useEffect race condition where form values were overwritten after save. Implemented isSaving flag solution to prevent race condition. Empirically verified fix using Chrome DevTools MCP integration with real-time DOM inspection and state monitoring. Created conventional commit with detailed technical explanation and pushed changes to feature branch. Updated product brief documentation for role management feature to reflect completed implementation.

Created separate development branch to Dockerize application after noting that the platform component upgrades recommended by GitHub Dependabot were very likely to represent breaking changes.  This is the start of a phased approach toward modernizing the ALT ERP. Worked in branch to begin the Dockerization process.

Executed AWS RDS MySQL upgrade for ALT production database (5.7.44 → 5.7.44-rds.20250818) using Blue/Green deployment. Created backup snapshot, provisioned upgraded environment, executed switchover with 57-second downtime. Validated database health and communicated completion to stakeholders. Status: Complete and operational.

Completed Docker implementation plan for Rails 5.2.7 application. Finished all Phase 1-3 tasks including: basic dockerization with multi-stage builds, development environment enhancement with hot reload and helper scripts, security hardening with credential removal, production Docker configuration with docker-compose.prod.yml, database migration strategy with backup/restore scripts, and health checks with monitoring endpoints. All 52 planned tasks across core phases validated and documented.

Conducted Google Meeting with Susan to configure GitHub workflow and review project status. Confirmed Susan's ability to post change requests, feature recommendations, and bug reports via GitHub Issues. Provided access to GitHub Copilot for codebase assistance. Configured repository notifications for new Issues and verified Susan receives update notifications. Reviewed and processed several notes and change requests, posting actionable items to Omnifocus. Discussed ALT's infrastructure improvement roadmap and current project status.

Drafted comprehensive AWS staging environment implementation roadmap for production-isolated testing. Plan includes AWS Elastic Beanstalk deployment with Docker containerization, RDS MySQL database (db.t3.micro), S3 storage, and ECR registry. Designed complete production isolation strategy with disabled external integrations (LabX API, Salesforce API, AWS SES). Documented 5-phase implementation timeline (1-2 weeks), cost breakdown (-40/month), safety features, testing procedures, and maintenance guidelines. Delivered plan to stakeholders via email and Slack.
Met with Ryan regarding his wiki documentation project. Discussed project requirements and generated business and technical specification reports.

Completed Wave 4 communication tasks for AWS RDS MySQL 8.0 upgrade project. Sent two professional HTML emails to the ALT team: (1) findings report summary covering current database state, Extended Support cost implications (,752/year doubling to ,504/year by March 2026), Blue/Green deployment recommendation, and ,760 cost savings over 3 years; (2) implementation roadmap detailing the six-phase upgrade plan with safety measures and team action items. Created and scheduled a calendar event for the upgrade implementation window on Saturday, November 15, 2025, 2:00-5:00 PM PST with all four team members (Kevin Blair, Jayson Bernstein, Susan Butch, Ryan Walsh) as attendees. Event includes links to both comprehensive documentation files and notes that implementation is subject to team review and approval.

Met with Susan via Google Meeting. Reviewed the Dockerized application and the operational staging server. Discussed the roadmap for the QA procedures. Reviewed current task list and specs for new task request regarding modifying the frequency determination logic for the LabX Sync. Updated the sync operation to use a hybrid approach for the daily sync for the sake of increasing the weight of ALT listings in LabX' algorithm. Deployed changes, then issued fixes, iterating until the deployment succeeded.

Monitored and course-corrected long term automated jobs, including comprehensive frontend QC review of dockerized site (running in a Git Worktree for partitioning) and troubleshooting the deployment of the new hybrid mode for LabX sync.
Investigated feasibility of a report of price changes per model over time and forwarded results with recommendations to Susan
Verified AWS Lambda LabX daily sync execution and schedule
